title: FirmWars
author: FirmWars
content: This was how I lost respect for someone I had always thought very highly of, we are both into Bitcoin investment so he knows what Bitcoin is all about until he told his followers that the idea behind buying and selling of Bitcoin is even a scam one makes me sick, he said buying and selling on others makes it a scam idea. I am highly disappointed because few other people believed this too, is the idea behind buying and selling a scam one? We went down into battle and I told him this. 1. If anyone feels that those who bought bitcoin very cheap are just waiting to sell on those who buys now they shouldn't buy, there is no one forcing them to. 2. The wrongful Idea to him is general, who dares buy a land for $200 and sell in few years for $210 got so that it won't look scammy? 3. I used Black rock and other big buyers today as examples too, they were never here when Bitcoin was at $100 per coin, why didn't they feel scammed buying at high price? Or why didn't they feel like they were just making early buyers richer? There are too many nonsense online out there, poisoning the mind of other people towards Bitcoin and the crazy part is, some people are on this forum right now and they still don't understand a thing about Bitcoin, they are surely here for a reason, I guess that is the gold rush part only, they lack the reasons why Bitcoin is highly valuable today.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: FirmWars on December 12, 2024, 01:02:54 PM1. If anyone feels that those who bought bitcoin very cheap are just waiting to sell on those who buys now they shouldn't buy, there is no one forcing them to. They must understand basics.Buyers want to buy low, sell high for profit.Sellers want to sell for profit with their lower entries.At the same price, in the same market, there are buyers who buy bitcoin from sellers, and let's see what they think with their actions. Sellers feel enough with profit and sell, except if they don't have profit but don't have money and emergency forces them to sell, even with loss.Buyers who buy bitcoins from sellers, because they believe that they are buying cheap and price will rise more after their entry.It's fair mutual deal between seller and buyer.Quote2. The wrongful Idea to him is general, who dares buy a land for $200 and sell in few years for $210 got so that it won't look scammy?Investment is risky, sometimes is good and sometimes is bad, but if you have profit, is it deserved to be called as scam?If you think like this, Gold can be considered as scam by Bitcoin investors especially Bitcoin maximalists.See ROIs of gold and Bitcoin. In ROI comparison, Gold looks very scammy.https://casebitcoin.com/

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: FirmWars on December 12, 2024, 01:02:54 PMThere are too many nonsense online out there, poisoning the mind of other people towards Bitcoin and the crazy part is, some people are on this forum right now and they still don't understand a thing about Bitcoin, These kinds of people exist in every crowd or community—people who are present in the community but have zero awareness about what the community is about. Usually, something different has attracted them to becoming members of this forum, and sometimes not only the knowledge about cryptocurrency or Bitcoin. Some people have joined the forum strictly with the intention to spam and join signature campaigns, others to learn and contribute, etc. Reasons differ; that is why you should not trust the knowledge of someone simply because they are from the forum; you should always verify.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Because people simply don't care with decentralization, privacy and security.Most people still think centralization institution is their friend, hence they don't care to give their identity to centralized exchanges and hand your coins to them. They don't have a high critical thinking to think "why I didn't get private keys/seed phrase", "why I need to submit KYC if Bitcoin is pseudonymous", "why I don't know whom I trade if Bitcoin is P2P" etc.People who bought Bitcoin due to it's utility is high unlikely to sell their coins.

comments.author: icalical
comments.body: Bitcoin is traded on perceived value and market conditions. This process works the same everywhere on other kind of investment, with the first movers usually getting the best returns, it doesn't make Bitcoin a scam. Large institutional investors like BlackRock have put more than billion into Bitcoin via ETFs. Even though Bitcoin community doesn't need affirmation from those big companies, but by integrating it into their portfolios, they have somewhat legitimized it.Dismissing trading in Bitcoin also ignores its growing global adoption as an alternative to traditional fiat systems. Skeptics might choose not to invest, but when they labeling Bitcoin as a scam, those skeptics ignore the fact of how bitcoin has growing role in diversifying investments and driving financial innovation worldwide.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Bitcoin is a commodity and trading it for profit is one of its features. Anyone that says buying bitcoin low and sell high is a scam is only jealous that people are making profit from it. Or is he talking about when you buy high and sell low due to panic because you lack the basic knowledge of bitcoin. That's not a scam but a lesson for you to know that bitcoin is not a get rich quick scheme but a long-term investment.

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: That is a big problem for influencers or people who do not know the truth or the real reason Bitcoin has value. They only think about how they could take advantage of other people's lack of knowledge so they could take advantage of them. It’s essential to spread the word about how and why Bitcoin has its value and why it would be ideal to get more of it.  Thinking less about it would help you, in my opinion. It would just stress you out.

comments.author: Jating
comments.body: Market is not just open 24x7, it is being traded around the world, globally. That alone shows that no one has control on when or how or who is going to buy, and then who is going to sell on the other part of the planet, and that makes Bitcoin very liquid market.If you are willing to sell at X price to make profit and someone on the other side thinks that it is a fair price and then he will also profited in the future, then I guess their is nothing scam on that kind of transaction.People just overthinks and over complicates Bitcoin right now. And I do agree with what the OP says that there a lot of nonsense specially that we hit $100k that could really poison those who don't understand Bitcoin market.

comments.author: X-ray
comments.body: definitely unhinged opinion where anyone could think selling on someone at higher price which means getting profit is a scam, that idea alone is just not true.the thing with investment is that there's something called opportunity cost, the early bird will always get the most because they believed in their investment earlier than anyone, same thing with stocks buyer, and so on.does people who bought stocks when company was still small scamming the people who bought just now? definitely not.but some people seem to not be able to realize that it's the cost of not believing into the investment earlier enough, but instead, waiting until things has gotten expensive and looks good first before investing, of course they'd be the one that gets to buy at higher price.
